DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate lidocaine-prilocaine ( EMLA 5 % ) cream reduce pain discomfort time vaginal pessary removal insertion . Half participant receive lidocaine-prilocaine ( EMLA 5 % ) cream half receive placebo cream .
DOC.brief_title: Topical Anesthetic Use In Pessary Management
DOC.detailed_description: Lidocaine-prilocaine ( EMLA 5 % ) cream show effective reduce pain minor gynecologic procedure . The primary objective trial determine use 5 % EMLA cream time pessary removal insertion reduces pain compare use placebo cream . Participants randomize receive either 10 gram 5 % EMLA cream ( 4 mL ) 4 mL placebo cream ( aqueous cream BP ) . Cream apply office time pessary removal insertion .
DOC.criteria: Women Loyola Urogynecology clinic use pessary management pelvic organ prolapse ( POP ) urinary incontinence ( UI ) Read speak English language NonEnglish speaking Allergy contraindication topical anesthetic Participation/randomization study previous visit Currently pregnant lactate planning pregnancy within next 6 month
